org.sbml.jsbml.util

Interface ProgressListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener

    public interface ProgressListener
extends java.util.EventListener
    The listener interface for receiving progress events. The class interested in handling these events should implement this interface.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andreas Dräger

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void progressFinish()
      This method is called when the process is finished, irrespective of the progress/total ratio.
      void progressStart(int total)
      Reports the total number of expected steps.
      void progressUpdate(int progress, java.lang.String message)
      Reports the current progress to this listener, i.e., progress < total.

    • Method Detail

      • progressStart

        void progressStart(int total)
        Reports the total number of expected steps. Note that in some use-cases the total number of steps might be unknown and therefore this method might be called with a very high default number, e.g., Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        total - the estimated total number of computation steps to be performed by this process.

      • progressUpdate

        void progressUpdate(int progress,
                    java.lang.String message)
        Reports the current progress to this listener, i.e., progress < total. Note that with every call of this method an increasing progress must be reported, i.e., two subsequent calls of this method must ensure that p1 < p2 (where p1 and p2 are the arguments passed to this method in the two subsequent calls).
        Parameters:
        progress - the number of steps that have been completed already
        message - can be null, a more detailed message to be displayed to the user in some way.

      • progressFinish

        void progressFinish()
        This method is called when the process is finished, irrespective of the progress/total ratio.
